title: The unexpected return of a valuable briefcase restored Sri's faith in humanity
description: After her dad died, Sri Pisharody flew to India with her mother and daughter. She told her daughter to be wary of the rickshaw drivers but then something happened that made her question what she said.

title: Afroman put home footage of a police raid in music videos. Now the cops are suing him
description: A police search of the rapper's Ohio home didn't lead to charges, but spawned music videos, merchandise, theft accusations and an invasion of privacy lawsuit. Afroman tells NPR he plans to countersue.

title: As the U.S. confronts a rising China, one country is right in the middle
description: This month, Australia struck a deal with the U.S. to acquire nuclear-powered submarine technology. It's a big moment for the country that has found itself itself caught between two world powers.

title: What a House GOP messaging bill could spell for 2024 culture war campaign
description: Although the GOP-led "Parents Bill of Rights" likely won't advance in the Democratic-controlled Senate, the messaging bill highlights Republican priorities as lawmakers eye the 2024 election cycle.

title: Transgender track and field athletes can't compete in women's international events
description: World Athletics Council said they prioritize fairness and the integrity of female track and field competitions, rather than inclusion. The ruling could hinder several Olympic medalists.

title: Women were already unequal in the world of global health. The pandemic made it worse
description: A new report from Women in Global Health looks at how much ground was lost — and what the impact is on health care.

title: Paul Rusesabagina, 'Hotel Rwanda' hero, will be released from prison
description: The man who inspired the novel and the Hollywood film Hotel Rwanda, Paul Rusesabagina, is due to be released from prison after the Rwandan government commuted his sentence.

title: Women's March Madness has been wilder than ever, but can anyone catch South Carolina?
description: For the first time this century, two No. 1 seeds didn't make it to NCAA women's basketball's Sweet 16. And teams who geared up with transfers are challenging historically dominant programs.

title: In a polarized Pakistan, Imran Khan accuses opponents of conspiracies
description: As a deeply polarized Pakistan confronts political and economic crises, Imran Khan, the embattled former prime minister, speaks with NPR from his home in Lahore.

title: 4 ex-Memphis police officers charged with Tyre Nichols' murder have been decertified
description: Decertification hearings for others investigated in his death are pending. Decertification prevents officers from going to work in the same jurisdiction. They can still get police jobs out of state.

title: U.S. and Canada reach a deal to close a popular but unofficial border crossing
description: President Biden and Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau are set to announce a deal that would allow both countries to turn away more migrants at unofficial border crossings.

title: Traveling overseas this summer? There's huge demand for passports, so get yours ASAP
description: Passports are in "unprecedented demand," U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said. In 2022, the State Department issued a record 22 million passports — and 2023 is on track to break that record.

title: India opposition leader loses his Parliament seat after being convicted of defamation
description: Key Indian opposition leader Rahul Gandhi was disqualified from the lawmaking body after a defamation conviction over his remarks about Prime Minister Narendra Modi's surname.

title: A giant trapdoor spider was discovered in Australia
description: The spider lives in open woodland habitats, building burrows in Central Queensland's black soils. Much of its habitat has been lost to land clearing, meaning it's likely an endangered species.

title: King Charles III postpones a trip to France as strikes and protest hobble the country
description: Workers already refused to roll out the red carpet for the British monarch's arrival, originally scheduled for Sunday. The French are protesting a decision to raise the retirement age to 64 from 62.

title: U.S. launches airstrikes in Syria after suspected Iranian drone kills a U.S. worker
description: An Iranian drone strike killed one U.S. contractor, injured five American service members and wounded one other contractor in Syria on Thursday, the Pentagon said.

title: The happiest country in the world wants to fly you in for a free masterclass
description: Finland has held the title of world's happiest country for six years running. It wants to teach people how to unlock their "inner Finn" during a four-day masterclass at a lakeside resort in June.

title: Vice President Harris is visiting Africa next week, part of a pushback to China
description: Vice President Harris will visit Ghana, Tanzania and Zambia to discuss issues like economic growth and food security. She's the highest-ranking administration official to travel to the continent.

title: The Senate Ethics Committee warns Lindsey Graham for fundraising in Senate building
description: South Carolina Sen. Lindsey Graham was sent a letter Thursday, in which the Senate Ethics Committee found he violated its rule about asking for campaign donations in federal buildings.

title: A wolverine has been seen outside of its normal range for the first time in 30 years
description: In Oregon, wolverines are typically located in the Wallowa Mountains in the northeast of the state. But the animal was seen near Portland this week.

title: Utah's new social media law means children will need approval from parents
description: The restrictions passed through Utah's Republican-supermajority Legislature reflect how politicians' perceptions of technology companies are changing — and that includes pro-business Republicans.

title: More than 1 million demonstrate across France against pension reforms
description: Building on Thursday's strong turnout, unions swiftly called for new protests and strikes next week when the British king is scheduled to visit Bordeaux on the second day of his trip to France.

title: Antisemitic incidents are at an all-time high, the ADL reports
description: The annual report says instances of harassment, assault and propaganda are all on the rise. It warns public officials and social media stars have helped normalize longstanding antisemitic tropes.
